title: BBC Local Live: Devon & Cornwall on Friday 13 October 2017 - BBC News
summary: arson suspect arrested after liskeard fire .
- two people were rescued from the burning building this morning .
'no armed police ' after school pupil threat .
exeter bus station to close 'by end of february ' and new leisure centre and coach station 'to open by end of 2020 ' .
remember the man engine ? it 's coming back to the south west for another tour .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: our live coverage
text: that 's all from bbc local live in devon and cornwall this friday .
we 'll be back on monday at 08:00 to bring you all the news , sport , travel and weather updates .
do n't forget spotlight this evening on bbc one at 18:30 with justin leigh and victoria graham and the late bulletin at 22:30 .
have a good weekend .

documents.title: driver warning for 'on the move ' deer
text: drivers are being warned to look out for deer on devon 's roads .
the highways agency and the group , the deer initiative , say there 's more risk of cars hitting the mammal at this time of the year as deer will be on the move for the autumn mating season .
they say there 's likely to be 74,000 deer-related road accidents this year .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: man in his 60s left with head injury after hit-and-run in village
text: a man was left with a head injury after a car with several young people hit him and drove off in a postcard village .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: saturday 's weather for devon and cornwall : sunny spells and light winds
text: it will be a cloudy and misty start , but some bright spells will develop through the morning , with some sunshine in the afternoon .
feeling pleasantly warm in light winds with a top temperature of 19c ( 66 f ) .
author: David Braine
Weather Forecaster

documents.title: hallelujah ! hospital staff sing and sing and sing and sing
text: hospital staff will be making a lot of noise for the next 24 hours - but it 's all in a good cause .
the members of the royal cornwall hospital choir are taking part in a `` singathon '' to raise money for the neo-natal and maternity departments at the hospital in truro .
the aim of the marathon song fest at truro 's methodist church is to raise £ 24,000 for the birth and baby appeal .
author: Jane Chandler
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: ready , set , go !
text: thousands of runners are gearing up to take part in this year 's great west run which takes place in exeter on sunday .
double olympic gold medalist james cracknell is leading the half marathon , which is expected to be the biggest in its 32 year history .
the 13.1 mile route will take in parts of the city centre and finish at the exeter arena in whipton .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: tool thief suspect sought
text: police have released an image of a man they wish to identify in connection with the theft of tools from a work van in plymouth on monday .
the vehicle was parked outside the baptist church on ham drive on monday 9 october at about 12:30 .
anyone with information is asked to contact devon and cornwall police .
author: Lynne French
BBC News Online

documents.title: why plymouth needs more bus lanes
text: the creation of a state-of-the-art bus network along all of plymouth 's major routes would solve the city 's daily congestion nightmare .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: cornwall 's fa cup history
text: truro city are aiming to become the first cornish club to make the fa cup first round in almost 50 years when they travel to hampton and richmond borough in the fourth qualifying round on saturday .
no club from cornwall has got to that stage since 1969 , when falmouth town were beaten 4-1 at home by peterborough united .

falmouth town were the first club from cornwall to reach the first round in 1962 when they lost 2-1 at home to oxford united , and made the same stage in 1967 when they were also beaten by peterborough .
the last time a cornish club made it to the fourth qualifying round was in 1998 , when st blazey were beaten by camberley town .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: homeless helped by torbay charity
text: a big rise in levels of homelessness in torbay has prompted local people living in the area to set up their own community group to help .
the number of homeless cases that torbay council has more than doubled since 2010 .
humanity torbay , which is privately funded , helps people get accommodation , training and jobs .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: batten down the hatches ophelia 's on her way !
text: the met office has issued a yellow warning for high winds on monday as the remnants of ex-hurricane ophelia reaches the uk .
gusts of between 55 and 65mph are expected to hit the west , with the potential for gusts of 80mph in coastal areas and large seas .
weather conditions could disrupt road , rail , air and ferry services , power lines and trees could be brought down and there could be some structural damage to buildings .
heavy rain is also possible .
the stormy weather is set to bring heavy swell around the south west , as shown in this image from surf forecasting website magicseaweed .
author: Lynne French
BBC News Online

documents.title: newton abbot college attack an 'isolated incident '
text: the head of newton abbot college says an unprovoked attack on one of its students is being viewed as an isolated incident .
the 16-year-old suffered a serious eye injury when he was attacked in the college car park last night by two teenagers , who punched him and kicked him in the face .
principal paul cornish said student safety was of paramount importance and he was in daily communication with the victim and his family and wished him a speedy recovery .
`` the police and college are currently of the view that this is an isolated incident and there is no need for unnecessary alarm , '' a statement added .
devon and cornwall police have appealed to anyone with information about the attack to contact them .
author: Lynne French
BBC News Online

documents.title: tisdale in 'no rush ' to sign new deal
text: exeter city manager paul tisdale says he is not in a hurry to complete negotiations over a new contract .
tisdale is almost halfway through his two-year notice period after exeter 's supporter 's trust - which owns the club - voted to renegotiate .
last month , city chairman julian tagg said a new deal was `` close '' with the efl 's longest-serving manager .
`` we 've got a long season ahead of us , there 's no imminent rush for anybody , '' tisdale told bbc sport .
fans voted to serve notice on tisdale when the club were bottom of the football league as they struggled to manage a long list of injuries .

but tisdale turned the club 's fortunes around , leading city to the league two play-off final last season and their best-ever start to a campaign this term with the club two points clear at the top of the fourth tier .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: man engine rises again
text: the huge mechanical puppet that toured former mining areas of cornwall last year is set to return .
creators of the man engine will take it on a 'resurrection tour ' next easter - through britain 's other mining heartlands - including yorkshire , derbyshire and south wales .
the 10-metre moving model of a cornish miner won 'best art project ' in the prestigious national lottery awards this year .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: three jailed for 'vicious and cowardly ' ammonia attack
text: three men have been jailed for a robbery in dawlish , where the victim was sprayed in the face with ammonia .

paul rowntree , 37 , from dawlish was jailed for 19 years ; rikki ward , 28 , from sunderland was jailed for 15 years three months ; and ross morton , 29 , from dawlish was jailed for three years at exeter crown court .
the attack and robbery took place at the dawlish costcutter story in january .
devon and cornwall police welcomed the sentencing , with det insp mike jones describing the attack on store manager neil warner as `` unprovoked , vicious and cowardly '' .
author: Lynne French
BBC News Online

documents.title: man jailed for rape will be allowed to try to clear his name
text: a man serving a six-year jail term after he was convicted of raping a woman has won the first stage of his fight to clear his name .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: elsie scully-hicks : injuries 'consistent with shaking '
text: an 18-month-old baby allegedly murdered by her adoptive father had bleeding on the brain consistent with a `` shaking type injury '' , a doctor has told a jury .
eighteen-month-old elsie scully-hicks died at cardiff 's university hospital of wales after suffering catastrophic injuries in may 2016 .
matthew scully-hicks , 31 , of delabole , cornwall , denies her murder .
paediatrician dr nia john was called from home to see the parents at the hospital following elsie 's ct scan .

dr john , a consultant community paediatrician responsible for child protection , recalled explaining to the scully-hicks that such bleeding on the brain could be an indicator of a non accidental injury .
she said : `` i remember explaining the usual pattern is a shaking type injury . ''
she said both men had appeared worried and upset , adding : `` people are different in these situations '' .
the trial continues .
author: BBC Wales News

documents.title: student 's eye injured in 'unprovoked ' attack
text: a 16-year-old boy has been injured in what police have described as a `` serious and unprovoked '' assault at newton abbot college .
he suffered a serious eye injury after being punched and kicked in the face by two teenagers in the college car park just before 23:00 on thursday .
the suspects are described as aged between 16 and 18 .
one was wearing a thigh-length hooded khaki coloured coat , blue jeans , a black baseball cap and black footwear , and was carrying a black bag around his neck .
the second had short dark hair and was wearing a grey hooded top , grey/green knee length shorts and black footwear .
anyone with information about the attack or who may know the identity of the offenders is asked to contact police .

documents.title: road closed by overturned vehicle
text: the road between harleston cross and port lane is closed due to an overturned vehicle , no injuries .
police on scene awaiting recovery .
author: Twitter

documents.title: new training park for 'noisy ' rugby players
text: a children 's rugby team banned from training in their local park for being too noisy have been given a new venue .
torbay council stopped paignton 's under-10s side from playing tag rugby after local residents complained of `` increased noise '' .
now the council has agreed to let the youngsters train at torbay park on a short-term basis until a more permanent solution `` that meets the needs of the club and community '' can be found .
author: Lynne French
BBC News Online

documents.title: bright spells this afternoon
text: brightening up throughout the afternoon , with some sunny spells in the east and a maximum temperature of 19c ( 66f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: power lifting 'changing women 's lives '
text: three mothers from cornwall who 've recently taken up the sport of power lifting say it 's changed their lives .
the women , including 42-year-old messiah makino , are taking part in a national competition this weekend .
her coach callum green believes she could lift 127kg ( 280lb ) which would see her break her personal best and set a new british record .
`` to see messiah do that would be e he added .
author: Andrea Ormsby
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: car overturns
text: a car has ended up on its roof after apparently driving off the car park of a hotel overlooking fistral beach at newquay .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: police appeal for missing boy
text: police are growing increasingly concerned for the welfare of a 15-year-old boy from plymouth .
kallum barritt has n't been seen since friday morning and police are appealing to the public to help them find him .
kallum is described as about 5ft 7in ( 1.7m ) tall , with cropped hair and of a slim build .
anyone with information is being asked to call 999 quoting log number 276 .
author: Hayley Westcott
Broadcast Journalist

documents.title: years more roadworks for tavistock road have just been announced
text: fed-up commuters in the north of plymouth face years more roadworks - after a new £ 15m overhaul of tavistock road was revealed .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: cruise ship passenger airlifted to hospital
text: a passenger who was unwell on a cruise ship has been airlifted to hospital by the newquay coastguard helicopter .
the vessel was 60 miles south east of plymouth and the passenger was taken to derriford hospital .
whilst everyone was still sleeping this morning , the newquay coastguard helicopter was making its way to an unwell cruise ship passenger in the # englishchannel # savinglives
you have to admire the men and women who work in the coastguard .
kudos to them .
great result guys , hope the casualty recovers soon
thanks 4 every one who works 4 the coastguard we really could not do we out u
how to get a job in maritime and coastguard please reply
nice wake up call : - )
hope the passenger was ok
congratulations on writing a great uk gov tweet .
( ranked 4th for oct 13 . )
author: Twitter

documents.title: travel update for cornwall : land 's end flights to scilly restart
text: travel update for cornwall : land 's end flights to scilly restart
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: diagouraga set to make argyle debut
text: toumani diagouraga could make his plymouth argyle debut on saturday as the bottom-of-the-table pilgrims host league one leaders shrewsbury town .
the former leeds united and brentford player joined earlier this week having been released by the yorkshire club in the summer .
oscar threlkeld is injured while gary miller is suspended , giving boss derek adams a dilemma over who to at right-back .
but adams is boosted by the return of suspended duo sonny bradley and david fox , while luke mccormick has returned to training .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: 'man engine ' makes its return
text: do you remember the man engine ?
it 's coming back to the south west for another tour .

the largest ever mechanical puppet built in the uk travelled the length and breadth of cornwall last year , celebrating the region 's mining heritage , and was later voted the uk 's best arts project in the annual national lottery awards .
next easter , the 10m high creation will travel from geevor tin mine to lostwithiel and tavistock before heading into somerset .
author: Emma Thomasson
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: devon 's hate crime victims speak out
text: there 's been a rise in the number of hate crimes reported in plymouth with the figure doubling from 20 to 40 since brexit .
police say one reason for the rise is that 23 centres have been set up where victims can report such crimes without going to the police station .
devon and cornwall have also seen an increase .
some local teenage victims have been speaking out as part of a video being sent to schools across the country to raise awareness of hate crimes .
they saw that they were affecting me but not emotionally , they just saw the physical thing - which was enough to make them carry on for years .
author: Anna Varle
BBC News Online

documents.title: wind warning issued for cornwall and west devon
text: a spell of very windy weather is likely to hit the region on monday , weather forecasters have said .
the met office said : `` road , rail , air and ferry services may be affected , with longer journeys times and cancellations possible .
power cuts may occur , with the potential to affect other services , such as mobile phone coverage .
`` some damage to buildings , such as tiles blown from roofs could happen , perhaps leading to injuries and danger to life from flying debris .
`` coastal routes , sea fronts and coastal communities may be affected by spray and/or large waves .
the warning has been issued on monday between 12:00 and 23:55 .

documents.title: travel update : collision blocks road
text: in atherington , the b3227 is partially blocked by a collision between a lorry and a van near the b3217 .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: elsie scully-hicks murder trial : photo of baby released
text: the first photograph of the baby girl at the centre of a murder trial has been released to the public .
elsie scully-hicks was 18 months old when she died after suffering catastrophic injuries in may 2016 .
her adoptive father , matthew scully-hicks , 31 , of delabole , cornwall , is on trial at cardiff crown court and denies her murder .
the photograph was issued by south wales police after judge mrs justice nicola davies approved its release .
author: BBC Wales News

documents.title: 'no armed police ' after school pupil threat
text: devon and cornwall police are investigating a threat made by a pupil against richard lander school in truro , but have denied claims that armed officers were involved .
a statement from the force said police were `` content this threat was not viable '' and the local policing team would continue to liaise with the school to monitor the situation .
`` at no time have armed police attended the school , '' the statement added .
cornwall council has also issued a statement which said the school took appropriate action as soon as it became aware of a threat by a student .
it concluded : `` investigations have confirmed that the student did not intend harm and that there is no danger to students or staff at the school .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: suspected arson in liskeard : what we know so far
text: suspected arson in liskeard : what we know so far
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: torquay aim to end bad fa cup run
text: torquay united aim to end their poor run of form in the fa cup when they travel to aldershot town on saturday .
the gulls have not won an fa cup game since winning at chesterfield in the first round in november 2011 - a run of seven games without a win .
gull boss gary owers - who reached the final with sunderland in 1992 - still has a host of first team players out injured .

jon-paul pitman , yan klukowski , myles anderson , sam chaney and jake gosling are all injured , but goalkeeper ryan clarke did play in a friendly earlier in the week having been out for almost two months with a back injury .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: boy 'seriously assaulted '
text: police are appealing for witnesses to what they say was a serious and unprovoked assault which happened in the car park at newton abbot college on thursday morning .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: all aboard ! china clay tunnel open for community ride
text: the longest underground road tunnel in cornwall , used to transport china clay , has been opened up to the public for a special trip .
chinal clay company imerys has invited a local community association to ride through the pinnock tunnel , which stretches nearly one-mile from par to fowey .
going underground .
pinnock tunnel from # par to # fowey is the longest road tunnel in cornwall .
imerys use it to carry china clay @ twitterid
better than the road into polruan !
been through there lots of times
wow ! !
you lucky thing , i would love to see that : ) # fowey # cornwall
author: Christine Butler
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: plans to protect exe estuary wildlife published
text: final proposals to protect conservation areas on the exe estuary are being published today .
they include a voluntary scheme prohibiting water users from wildlife refuges at dawlish warren and exmouth .
the report says birds are currently being disturbed by estuary users and their habitats are deteriorating , with some migrating birds `` on the point of death '' .
councillors from east devon , teignbridge and exeter will vote on the plans at a meeting on 23 october .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: police at richard lander school as parents demand explanation
text: parents of pupils at a truro school are demanding an explanation after armed police are said to have turned up twice this week .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: breakingtwo rescued from burning building
text: two people have been rescued from a burning building in liskeard .
firefighters from the town , callington , bodmin , lostwithiel , and looe were called to the blaze in dean street just before 06:30 .
the fire is believed to have been started deliberately and devon and cornwall police have arrested a man on sus of arson .
author: Lynne French
BBC News Online

documents.title: is friday 13th unlucky for you ?
text: it 's friday 13th , the most cursed day in the calendar - allegedly - where everything is fated to go wrong .
but where did we get the idea that it 's a date when bad things happen ?
because friday was the day of the crucifixion , fridays were always regarded as a day of penance and abstinence .
this religious belief spilled over into a general dislike of starting anything - or doing anything important - on a friday .
author: Jennifer Meierhans
BBC News Online

documents.title: gaping hole left in plymouth street after burst water main
text: a quiet residential street in plymouth has been closed after a water main burst in the middle of the night .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: brexit a 'turning point ' for reports of hate crime
text: reports of hate crime in plymouth have doubled since brexit with 40 incidents on average being reported now compared to around 20 before the vote , police have said .
the rise is also down to the fact that victims no longer have to go a police station to report such crimes - there are now 23 allocated centres where people can go .
elsewhere , the rest of devon and cornwall have also seen an increase in levels of reporting .
sgt graham little said it was vital victims reported hate crime , even if they felt it was n't important .
author: Anna Varle
BBC News Online

documents.title: tide times for devon and cornwall
text: if you 're planning a trip to the coast today , here are the times of high water .
there will be a full forecast in the lunchtime news at 13:30 on bbc one .
author: Dan Downs, Weather Forecaster

documents.title: breakingarson suspect arrested after liskeard fire
text: a man 's been arrested on sus of arson after a sus fire in liskeard in the bay tree hill area .
devon and cornwall police said the alarm was raised at about 06:30 .
crews from cornwall fire and rescue service are at the scene , but it 's not thought anyone 's been hurt in the incident .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: devon schools ranked by gcse result
text: every single school in devon has been ranked depending on its performance over the last year .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: travel update for cornwall : accident near trerulefoot roundabout
text: travel update for cornwall : accident near trerulefoot roundabout
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: travel update for devon : three-car crash in woodbury
text: travel update for devon : three-car crash in woodbury
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: exeter bus station to close 'by end of february '
text: the latest plans for the long awaited redevelopment of exeter 's bus station have been backed by city councillors .
at an extraordinary meeting , recommendations were supported to close the existing bus station by the end of february 2018 .
it was due to close at the end of october 2017 .
passengers will be up and dropped off in the street during the closure , allowing the new bus station and leisure centre to be built .
it is expected to open by the end of 2020 .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: weather for devon and cornwall : mainly dry with some bright spells
text: a cloudy start with a little drizzle over the moors and odd showers elsewhere .
however it will brighten up throughout the day , with some sunny spells in the east by the afternoon and a maximum temperature of 19c ( 66f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: truro city aim to make fa cup history
text: truro city are one win away from becoming the first cornish club to reach the first round of the fa cup since 1969 .

to jog your memory of how long ago that was - butch cassidy and the sundance kid was the top film in the united states , sugar sugar by the archies was the uk number one and george lazenby was about to make his one and only outing as james bond in on her majesty 's secret service .
the white tigers have never played in the fourth qualifying round before , but could go one stage further if they can win at national league south rivals hampton and richmond borough on saturday .
`` we 've broken a club record with being in the fourth qualifying round , and now it 's a case of those boys going to enjoy the day and going to perform , '' says city 's manager lee hodges .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: i 'll be back ! - award-winning giant man engine returns
text: a giant puppet , created to celebrate cornwall 's mining heritage , is coming back to the south west next year .
last year , the 10m ( 33ft ) man engine travelled the length and breadth of the county and was later voted the uk 's best arts project in the annual national lottery awards .
it 's been announced the creation , which is operated with ropes , will travel from geevor tin mine at easter to lostwithiel , before travelling to tavistock then on into somerset .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: city hate crime figures 'double '
text: the number of hate crimes being reported in plymouth has doubled in the past year .
devon and cornwall police said in 2016 the force was getting about 20 incidents a month , but it 's now seeing an average of 40 .
levels of reporting have also increased across the devon and cornwall force area .
author: Anna Varle
BBC News Online

documents.title: news , sport , weather and travel for friday
text: good friday morning from bbc local live .
we 'll be bringing you the news , sport , travel and weather today for devon and cornwall .
if you have a story or want to get in touch , please email us .
author: Lynne French
BBC News Online
